content.raw:
I have a bunch of nitpicky UX stuff I'll lay down here. It's not necessarily all related to this pull request, and it's not critical from a technical standpoint--just some preliminary user data for @spaepcke :)

The bounding box for selecting joints is huge. It seems a bit excessive because a large amount of the bounding area is empty, and it doesn't match up with the area that will select the joint when clicked. Maybe the BB should just be as wide as the endpoints of the joints?

The "Add" button under "Custom" is also excessively large. It also seems awkward that it's under its own drop-down menu--are there more plans for buttons undre "Custom"?

Is the joint inspector functionality implemented yet or is it just a stub? I tried changing the "Anchor" fields, expecting them to change the attachment point of the joint, but it didn't do anything after hitting Apply or OK...

-1000 and 1000 seem like unrealistic default values for a revolute joint.

Two links connected by a Universal joint end up flying into the distance when the model is saved and the Model Editor is closed. Two links connected by a screw joint stay still but fly into the distance when disturbed by translation or rotation. These may be physics engine issues, but I theorize giving each joint reasonable default values may improve user experience...

The changing text next to the checkboxes was confusing for me, I think just a checkbox next to "Static" or "Auto-disable" is enough. A checkbox next to "False" could mean "check to make this value false" OR "this value is currently false"

It's not immediately clear what "Auto-disable" does.
